version_description:
- Edit Sleep Notes of previous sleep sessions.
- Change the set alarm time during active sleep session.
- Turn off or restart Sleep Aid during active sleep session.
- Weather feature reactivated.
- New design for setting alarm.
- Various fixes and improvements.

* Fixed a SleepSecure issue
* General stability and performance improvements

After two years of extensive research and testing, Sleep Cycle introduces:

Patented Sound Analysis Sleep Tracking

ELIMINATING THE NEED FOR PHONES IN BED
New groundbreaking sound analysis technology with a new patented intelligent algorithm, trained to identify sounds generated by your movements in bed during sleep. Place the phone near the bed or on the floor and Sleep Cycle's sound analysis will track your sleep and wake you up at the optimal time in the morning.

Using machine learning, Sleep Cycle automatically identifies and ignores all sounds that are not generated from your movements in bed.
Two in the bed? Sleep Cycle will now link both phones automatically to each other and determine from where the sound is coming from, before adding it to the sleep analysis of the correct user.

(Enable sound analysis under Settings / Motion detection)

TRENDS
A new tab focused entirely on your long term sleep trends, giving you all the in-depth information, correlations and visual overviews you need.
Connecting you to the world of sleep through sleep stats from across the globe.

MINOR CHANGES
Solved an issue where the alarm could be silent when using your own music and iOS9.
Improved algorithm for Sleep Quality.
iOS9 ready with refreshed design and typography.
Several other performance and stability improvements.

5.0.1

Fixed an issue where existing paying users did not get Premium for free automatically (forever).
Important bug fixes and improvements.

5.0:

After two years of extensive research and testing, Sleep Cycle introduces:

Patented Sound Analysis Sleep Tracking

ELIMINATING THE NEED FOR PHONES IN BED
New groundbreaking sound analysis technology with a new patented intelligent algorithm, trained to identify sounds generated by your movements in bed during sleep. Place the phone near the bed or on the floor and Sleep Cycle’s sound analysis will track your sleep and wake you up at the optimal time in the morning. Using machine learning, Sleep Cycle automatically identifies and ignores all sounds that are not generated from your movements in bed. Two in the bed? Sleep Cycle will now link both phones automatically to each other and determine from where the sound is coming from, before adding it to the sleep analysis of the correct user.
(Enable sound analysis under Settings/Motion detection)

TRENDS
A new tab focuses entirely on long term sleep trends, giving you all the in-depth information, correlations and visual overviews you need. Connecting you to the world of sleep through sleep stats from across the globe.
Bug fixes and improvements

- iPad support! With this update, iPad users can finally wake up as happy as iPhone users.

- New graph! Sleep quality affected by location. Get new insights on how the location affects your sleep quality.

- ’Dont show again' button on the nightly charging and placement reminder. (We've been reminding you for seven years now, we thought it was about time you could opt out).

- Average sleep time is back under statistics. We heard you missed it. So we've put it back.

- New improved help section gives you access to Sleep Cycle articles and FAQ.

- Several bugfixes and stability improvements.

- Fixed Health app integration. We’re sending “time asleep” to Health app again.
- Stability and performance improvements.
- Stability and performance improvements.

- New trend graph shows how the moon cycle affects your sleep quality
- Phillips HUE updates including support for Phillips HUE 2.0.
- New alarm melodies and ambient alarm sounds
- Bug fixes and stability improvements

Added new languages: Russian, Turkish, Korean, Portuguese (Brazil) and Chinese (Tr.).
Minor bug fixes and improvements.
Minor bug fixes and improvements.

Adjusted automatic microphone calibration for users switching to new devices.
Additional bug fixes and improvements.
Minor bug fixes and improvements.
Bug fixes and improvements
Bug fixes and improvements.

INTRODUCING SNORE DETECTION

Maybe you snore. Maybe you don’t. But a third of the adult population do. Despite getting a full night’s sleep, they don’t know why they’re tired or annoyed, anxious or deprived. But that’s what poor sleep does to you, and snoring is part of poor sleep.

Well, not anymore. Using our patented sound technology to analyse the quality of your sleep, we’re now able to detect your snoring. If you’re one of those thirds, then Sleep Cycle is the first step to help get you on track to resolve your snoring and earn that sleep quality you deserve.
Snore detection implemented in Trends. With the latest release, Sleep Cycle does not only detect, measure, and track your snoring - it also gives you historical snore data in the Premium Trends view.
Bug fixes and improvements
Bug fixes and improvements
New optimizations for iPhone X and iPhone 8, including improved heart rate reading and support to keep device face up during night.

Adaptations for iOS 11 and iPhone X.
Bug fixes and improvements.
New optimizations for iPhone X and iPhone 8, including improved heart rate reading and support to keep device face up during night.

To snoozers and snorers delight, we introduce Sleep Cycle Apple Watch App.

No more snore. The new Watch App gently nudges your wrist when it detects snoring. The gentle nudge will not cause you to wake up, but it will have you change position without knowing it and stop snoring. No snore means better quality sleep.

Your family can rest assured - that you get up on time without disturbing them. Sleep Cycle Apple Watch App offers silent wake up. Wake up by silent haptics on your wrist, with no disturbance to the rest of the house.

Heart of the matter. Sleep Cycle now tracks your heart rate average throughout the night via the Watch App, automatically.

Heart of the matter. Sleep Cycle now tracks your heart rate average throughout the night via the Watch App, automatically.
Minor bug fixes and improvements.
This release contains the usual tricks and fixes that make Sleep Cycle slightly better than before. Even a bug hunt deserves an update, after all.

Our Sleep Aid content is now available for everyone. While the content remains in English still, you can just enter the Sleep Aid world now and flip a switch (it's right there, you can't miss it) and it's all yours, no matter your language or nationality.

- This release includes some important bug fixes, including a fix for an issue that caused the app to forget which sleep aid was previously used.
Bug fixes and improvements.
In this we release, we fixed a crash issue in the payments screen and tweaked a few minor things with handling expired subscriptions.
This release addresses issues when creating an account.
Some minor bug fixes.

New: Downloadable Sleep Aid content - With soothing sleep stories that will help you relax and fall asleep easier. 

Also: We continuously work on improving stability and correcting any bugs that we might find in Sleep Cycle, whilst simultaneously doing our best not to introduce any new defects... we believe this release is a step in the right direction.
Fixes issues we've had with our onboarding process plus other bug fixes
Bug fixes and improvements.
We regularly work on improving the stability and performance of our app... By time, all these minor fixes adds up to a release that's worthy to proclaim it contains: "Bug fixes and improvements".
Minor bug fixes and improvements.

We finally dared to look into the eyes of our sound analysis engine, and we came to mutual agreement that it could be improved. So we have, and you’ll find that we’ve reduced battery consumption overnight, significantly.
Since we’re on a roll, we also threw in the option to let you play sounds from other sources now, even through headphones or speakers.
Quite a day at the Sleep Cycle lab.

In this release, we’re now supporting the new iPhone XS Max, the iPhone XR and the Watch Series 4, not to mention the updated WatchOS 5 for all devices. That’s a lot of numbers and letters, but the magic of waking up at the right time, remains.

Fixed issue affecting heart rate measurements using the camera.
Additional bug fixes and improvements.
Bug fixes and improvements
In this release, we've mostly squashed bugs and worked on stability. Even a bug deserves a good night's sleep, after all.
Minor bug fixes and improvements.
Minor bug fixes and improvements.

If you were an early adopter of this, you’ll find that this update includes improvements on stability as well a few bug fixes from the previous version.
Since we’re on a roll, we also threw in the option to let you play sounds from other sources now, even through headphones or speakers.

Bug fixes and improvements.
Bug fixes and improvements.

This, dear friends, is a big one, where we give you a complete visual redesign that sets the bar for what’s to come. Don’t worry, it’s the same app with the same features. Only a lot more prettier now. And prepared for greater things on the frontiers of sleep.
In this release, we squashed a few pesky bugs involving the alarm volume and battery monitoring, and made some other minor improvements in various sections.
In this release, we squashed a few pesky bugs involving the onboarding process and made some other minor improvements in various sections.
Some minor bug fixes.
This release addresses issues when creating an account.
In this we release, we fixed a crash issue in the payments screen and tweaked a few minor things with handling expired subscriptions.

- Fixed weekend mode not working properly
- Fixed online backup sync issues for older devices
- Fixed a problem with alarm not sounding after snoozing sometimes
- Fixed crash due to audio recording format problems
- And some minor tweaks, fixes and improvements
Fixes issues we've had with our onboarding process plus other bug fixes
Fixes issues we've had with our onboarding process plus other bug fixes

New: Downloadable Sleep Aid content - With soothing sleep stories that will help you relax and fall asleep easier. 

Also: We continuously work on improving stability and correcting any bugs that we might find in Sleep Cycle, whilst simultaneously doing our best not to introduce any new defects... we believe this release is a step in the right direction.

- Fixed Sleep Aid selection defect
- Stability fixes and improvements
- Corrected some missing translations
- And some other minor fixes and adjustments
Bug fixes and improvements.

Now is the time for regularity. Sleep regularity, that is. To measure your time to bed, your time to rise, and how it might impact the quality of your sleep. And if you didn’t already know, regularity is one of the single most important factors for better sleep. Enjoy.

Now is the time for regularity. Sleep regularity, that is. To measure your time to bed, your time to rise, and how it might impact the quality of your sleep. And if you didn’t already know, regularity is one of the single most important factors for better sleep. Enjoy.

This is one of Sleep Cycle’s most ambitious releases yet, our new Sleep Aid program. You’re welcome to our world of stories on kitchen sunsets or lighthouses by the sea. Follow our relaxing guides to a quiet grove or a white beach under pastel skies, or enjoy the beat of rhymes on sleep and dreams. If words aren’t your thing, there’s ethereal music or ambient piano pieces, or the comforting babble of a forest stream. All narrative content is English only for now, but that will change in the future. Enjoy.

If words aren’t your thing, there’s ethereal music or ambient piano pieces, or the comforting babble of a forest stream. All narrative content is English only for now, but that will change in the future. Enjoy.
New improved Sleep Notes! Tap the Info button in our now greatly expanded view of Sleep Notes, to learn more about how to improve your sleep by understanding your habits.

Our Sleep Aid content is now available for everyone. While the content remains in English still, you can just enter the Sleep Aid world now and flip a switch (it's right there, you can't miss it) and it's all yours, no matter your language or nationality.

Our Sleep Aid content is now available for everyone. While the content remains in English still, you can just enter the Sleep Aid world now and flip a switch (it's right there, you can't miss it) and it's all yours, no matter your language or nationality.

- This release includes some important bug fixes, including a fix for an issue that caused the app to forget which sleep aid was previously used.

- Sleep Aid content now fully streamable with instant listening
- Average chart line brought back in statistics
- Fixed an issue where fall asleep time was incorrectly estimated
- Resolved a bug where the wrong time asleep value was exported to HealthKit
- Several bug fixes and improvements

- More gentle alarm volume during wake-up
- Revamped critical battery warning
- Plus a multitude of minor fixes and improvements
It took us awhile. But now it's here. Welcome, Siri. Say hello to Shortcuts.
Fixes an issue with the alarm volume being way too low, which some users experienced.
Bug fixes and improvements

- New improved partner link interface and options
- Fixed an issue with bluetooth connected audio devices (iOS 13.4 required)
- And a few other minor tweaks and fixes
Bugfixes and improvements
Bugfixes and improvements

Your sleep data is alive. From now on, we'll offer you insights in the journal on anything and everything regarding your sleep.
We also corrected an issue with vibrate on snooze, as well as some additional bug fixes and improvements.
